title: Tyler1.  Is unbanned ! Unban me ?
body: Now can I get an actual riot employee to talk to me one on one in private ? The copy and pasting of support is just a waste of time  I can legit sit here and show proof of them just treating my case like it doesn't matter . I need a manual review now...

replies.body:
While Necromancy may be handy (and sometimes needed) in media, it is not the case for old forum threads. Please avoid using such magic and be mindful of how old threads are before posting.

Feel free to contact us at the [Moderation Discord](https://discordapp.com/channels/230113905668653056/306220435262144512) or at [Discuss the Boards]( https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/community-moderation) for any questions, comments or concerns about this. Thank you and have a good day.

Sure, if you are ID banned like Tyler1 I'd be happy to review your ID level ban.

.. checking .. nope you aren't one of the people with an ID level ban.

You got 4 penalties in about a month. Looking at your logs, they all look deserved. What is it you think should be done? Player support likely replied saying the bans were going to stand, and why. Of course they are going to use a macro because else they would have to retype the same thing to each personal writing in with a just ban. When you wrote in, they looked at your case.

> [{quoted}](name=Riot Tantram,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=bVTNtNwY,comment-id=0005,timestamp=2018-01-04T22:17:14.416+0000)
>
> Sure, if you are ID banned like Tyler1 I'd be happy to review your ID level ban.

Of course they are going to use a macro because else they would have to retype the same thing to each personal writing in with a just ban. When you wrote in, they looked at your case.

https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/de/c/player-behavior-moderation/8a75KeUR-the-indefinite-banning-of-tyler1



Hey all,

Instant Feedback catches the most unsportsmanlike players in League, but some people go out of their way to continue ruining games for the community. Because of a well-documented history of account bans for verbal abuse, intentional feeding, as well as account sharing/purchasing, evasion of sportsmanship systems, and player harassment, _**we will not allow Tyler1 to hold a League of Legends account, indefinitely.**_ Any account definitively used by him will be banned immediately upon identification.

We know we’re not perfect, and this dragged on too long, but we want you to know when the rare player comes along who’s a genuine jerk, we’ve still got your back.



so why talking shit? Rioter
I see you did not include the quote from Phreak when he said he was open to tyler being unbanned if he got his shit together. Interesting.

> [{quoted}](name=SquishyRyu,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=bVTNtNwY,comment-id=000500000000,timestamp=2018-01-04T22:28:29.353+0000)
>
> I see you did not include the quote from Phreak when he said he was open to tyler being unbanned if he got his shit together. Interesting.

source?
(https://youtu.be/QIv_mpTEwEc)

> [{quoted}](name=SquishyRyu,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=bVTNtNwY,comment-id=00050000000000000000,timestamp=2018-01-04T22:33:47.463+0000)
>
> (https://youtu.be/QIv_mpTEwEc)

and btw we will not allow Tyler1 to hold a League of Legends account, **indefinitely. indefinitely. indefinitely. indefinitely. indefinitely. indefinitely. indefinitely.**

Indeed.  Lets look at **indefinitely** then.

Definition of indefinitely:
"for an unlimited or _unspecified_ period of time."

Not to be confused with eternal:
"lasting or existing _forever_; without end or beginning."
Indefinitely is not synonymous with forever. Check your nearest dictionary.

> [{quoted}](name=Periscope,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=bVTNtNwY,comment-id=0005000000000000000000000001,timestamp=2018-01-04T22:39:05.016+0000)
>
> Indefinitely is not synonymous with forever. Check your nearest dictionary.

wtf lmao my nearest dictionary said: forever, for always, for good, for good and all, evermore, for ever and ever, for all time, until the end of time, eternally, undyingly, permanently, perpetually, in perpetuity



get ur shit bra

My apologies. I should have directed you to a thesaurus (since I had brought up synonyms). But indefinite most nearly means *not definite*. In other words, there was no set end point for his ID unban; it was set to be ongoing until otherwise stated.

And what is your source?

This is not a reply.

In the video Phreak literally said that tyler _could_ be unbanned from league, but that he (tyler) was responsible for whether or not that happened. Obviously tyler's got his shit together because he's unbanned. I don't understand what your problem is with that.

> [{quoted}](name=SquishyRyu,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=bVTNtNwY,comment-id=0005000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2018-01-04T22:37:53.158+0000)
>
> This is not a reply.
> 
> In the video Phreak literally said that tyler _could_ be unbanned from league, but that he (tyler) was responsible for whether or not that happened. Obviously tyler's got his shit together because he's unbanned. I don't understand what your problem is with that.

The problem is he broke **Almost** every rule in the SC and its almost like riot is absolving him of **ANY AND ALL SIN** 
"Yeah lets let him stream again and make cash off the game again but fuck any previous actions taken against him and fuck everything hes done in the past"

This guy encouraged his viewers to actively run it down mid if they didnt get what they wanted 
This guy should never be allowed back into the community WHAT SO EVER

**RIOT GAMES IS LITERALLY BENDING OVER AND LICKING TYLER1'S ASSHOLE RIGHT NOW**

mmm tyler lemme lick it nice and clean for you
mmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmm

"This guy should never be allowed back into the community WHAT SO EVER" disagree. Tyler was consistently toxic in game but not beyond that. If he has reformed then he should get another chance. Phreak said as much and he also took a lot of shit from tyler. 

Riot isn't sucking off tyler, they're giving him another shot because he has shown he's changed. And yes, it is good to have an extremely skilled player with a large following back in league especially if they _aren't toxic anymore_
The quote from phreak helps prove my point do either way .

It really doesn't. You, unlike tyler, was not ID banned and you, unlike tyler, are still toxic. 

Try again

If you say so . Since I'm toxic you can leave the post , or better yet I'll ignore you 
Good day toxic player !

The edge is strong in this one

lmao
I don't understand your point.
Idk if you saw this, but he misunderstood what indefinite meant.  He thought it meant infinite, or never ending.  He probably missed the double negative of in- de.

They all look deserved ? You're gonna sit here and tell me that it looks deserved ? I strongly disagree, yea maybe everyone here is upvoting you because you will "always be right" and I will "always be wrong " but Im sorry I don't see how that is deserved .
I got a 2 week ban from saying "I'm a school shooter " and telling someone to "STFU and ping your lane " because they were tilted .
I got a permaban because I said to report a player basically and on the other one  I tried to prove a point by saying "if I afk I can end the game" because my teammate was being rude to me. 
How does that even warrant a permaban, no disrespect ofc but I need to know.
And customer support shouldn't have copy and pasterino  it feels like they don't even read a word you say, instead they just paste into it .
I'm sorry if you view it differently but tyler1 was still UNBANNED! because riot  believed he changed, it's not wrong to believe that he gets special treatment  ...  Other players don't get a chance  to prove they reformed . No level 20 challenge etc .

> They all look deserved ? You're gonna sit here and tell me that it looks deserved ? I strongly disagree, yea maybe everyone here is upvoting you because you will "always be right" and I will "always be wrong " but Im sorry I don't see how that is deserved .

Go ahead and post your chat logs here. 

> I'm sorry if you view it differently but tyler1 was still UNBANNED! because riot believed he changed, it's not wrong to believe that he gets special treatment ... Other players don't get a chance to prove they reformed . 

We had no ID ban policy, and enacted one sometime last year. When we did that, all ID banned players were then subjected to the same rules. There would be a review period for these players. ID banned players do not get their accounts back. You are welcome to make a new account, just like they have to do when they are no longer ID banned.

And on supports page an ID ban is more severe then a permanent ban, if that's the case why can a person recover from a permanent ban and a permanently banned player can't ?
And you've stated that I'm free to create a new account but that makes the permanent banning
Riot doesn't provide logs in that format. Where are you getting those from?

Sorry but this conversation does not involve you . Riot does send them in that format because I obviously have them.
Edit: Sorry that was mean , all these people being jerks to me . I asked  riot support to send me the logs after the ticket. I copy and pasted and saved it in Gmail .

I'm sorry, what?

I expected some sort of other excuse as to where you got those logs. Not you doubling down.

I'm a regular in the PB forums, I know what reform logs look like. There's no time stamps, and there's no differentiation between team chat and /all chat. It would be one thing for you to have some other method of providing these logs, but insisting they came in your reform card is... fishy.

Uh no , if you read my edited comment above I got them from player support . Sorry but no fish over here ..
Riot tantram can confirm these .. why would I lie and post someone else's or even make my own ?

Okay, that makes more sense.

It would have been a ton of effort to fake all that extra detail, I just didn't follow where the logs came from.

ID Ban = all your current accounts are perma-banned and you're prohibited to even create a new account.
When the ID Ban is lifted, you are once again allowed to create a fresh new account, **but all your old accounts are still perma-banned.**

You are asking to get back your old account. This NEVER happens. Never. Not even when an ID Ban is lifted, they don't get their old accounts back, they are just allowed to create a new one from scratch, they have to grind levels, re-buy champs and skins, etc.

As Tantram said, you are not ID Banned, so you're free to create a new account and start from scratch, just as Tyler1 will have to do.

But does no one understand that Tyler 1 can literally buy every champ if he wanted? You obviously don't . He streams and gets  tipped hundreds of dollars , meanwhile a broke 16 yo kid like me cannot do that . If you look at my account I've only had negative history in this ONE month . I've never gotten any kind of restrictions or anything in the game until the one month I started playing  in my mind yea .. what I said was wrong but I don't think I need to be permabanned for it . Just take away my chat privileges WTH...

Do you not understand that is equivalent to a job in this case? Yes he streams, yes he gets donations, and yes he could buy rp to get champs/skins he wants.

You know who else can? People who have jobs and a desire to own the champions. Maybe it will take longer because some will do it in increments to budget, but they could.

Im a 16 year old student so no i cant, stop assuming.
you dont know my situation in my life and neither am i obligated to tell you it!
goodbye

I didn't assume anything about you. You gave an argument about T1 being able to just by all his things again and found it unfair. I provided a counter saying anyone who works could do the same. His job is just different.

> But does no one understand that Tyler 1 can literally buy every champ if he wanted? You obviously don't . He streams and gets tipped hundreds of dollars , meanwhile a broke 16 yo kid like me cannot do that .

This is irrelevant, you're talking about wanting to get your account unbanned because someone who suffered an ID ban got it overturned, allowing them to create new accounts again. So what if Tyler1 can rebuy everything he had/wants? So what if you can't?

The only thing that remains the same is that _**Tyler1's case is different from yours.**_

> If you look at my account I've only had negative history in this ONE month . I've never gotten any kind of restrictions or anything in the game until the one month I started playing in my mind yea .. what I said was wrong but I don't think I need to be permabanned for it . Just take away my chat privileges WTH...

So you're going to tell me that over the course of a single month, you got two chat restrictions and a fourteen day ban, and didn't _once_ consider changing what you were doing? It didn't even once occur to you - particularly with the 14-day ban - that you could lose your account if you kept going like you were?

Taking away your chat privileges wouldn't help. Riot's already tried indefinite chat restrictions, and it failed miserably. The vast majority of players under that punishment would just troll, grief, or intentionally feed to spite their teammates where otherwise they would have just flamed.

And if you spiralled out of control and lost your account over the course of a month, I doubt you would be any different.

The point of banning players for toxicity is to tell them that, since they can't reform, since they can't figure out _why_ they're getting punished, or probably don't _care_ to know, they don't belong in the League of Legends community. If you realized only _after_ the fact that your chat was wrong, then that's completely on you.
Useless . You're not fixing anything and a player can always come back from a permanent ban, and if that player isn't reformed you haven't gotten rid of a toxic player ..

> [{quoted}](name=Wesker997,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=bVTNtNwY,comment-id=00050002000000010000,timestamp=2018-01-05T00:06:03.431+0000)
>
> Useless . You're not fixing anything and a player can always come back from a permanent ban, and if that player isn't reformed you haven't gotten rid of a toxic player ..

Riot is well aware that they can't stop people from making new accounts and that some people will always be toxic no matter what. All they can do is continue to punish them on their new account if they continue to act up, or worse case scenario ID ban them.

Kinda harsh to get a ban for these logs IMO. That being said, they definitely aren't nice logs.

I wish more people would use the mute feature instead of reporting annoying people.

Other players shouldn't have to deal with annoying people. Annoying people shouldn't be allowed to go about freely being annoying.

Reporting them both helps the community to avoid having to deal with them, and (hopefully) points out to the annoying player that they need to cut the shit.

It may be harsh, but frankly, I'd rather not deal with annoying people ruining my games.
Agreed -_-

Sure, but lets look at both sides then:

Not everyone has their accounts banned on sight without performing constant toxic behaviour on them either (which is the ban type he had).

Most players get warnings like their 10 and 25 game chat bans, and then a 14-day suspension which explicitly tells them it's the last straw and the next punishment is a perma.

Those players can just _stop being toxic_ and they would keep their account.
